Posts.Content: On 9/12/2007 Niki63 wrote: I was on Arimidex for 3 months but had to stop because of severe joint pain and weakness.  Changed to Aromasin.  Joint pain got better.  However, over 7 months developed carpal tunnel problems in both hands and trigger finger in right thumb which all required surgery.  Also, had cortisone shot in wrist because of tendonitis. I have foot pain, stiffness, and swelling such that my gait is much worse than my 90 year-old parents.  It never occurred to me that these problems were related to Aromasin.  I thought it was somehow due to lasting effects of chemo.  I am sorry that I didn't find this site sooner and avoided all this unnecessary pain and surgery.  My doctor, who treats a lot of us, has not seen these side effects before, as apparently they occur in less than 2% of us.  Been off Aromasin for 5 weeks and feet seem to be getting a little better.  I hope that this continues.  You all can tell me if this is the case.  Will start Tomaxifin next and hope that I can tolerate it better than AI's.  Thanks for sharing all of your experiences.  Niki  Dear Niki, I am a 5 year breast cancer survivor.  I am estrogen tested positive and was on an estrogen blocker call Fareston for the past 5 years with little side affects.  I could only take it for 5 years and my onchologist told me they had a relatively new drug called Aromasin and she recommended I take it. Apparently it has had great results.  At the same time I started taking the drug, I started walking 3 days a week and going to curves 3 days a week.  I have never been one to exercise but was really sticking to it.  My feet and hands started hurting and my hot flashes were worse and I was extremely tired and felt heavy.  I could stand to lose l5 lbs but I'm not large and had been doing this routine for 6 weeks.  I'm 63.  I thought I should be feeling good.  I had also been eating healthier and taking supplements.  I decided the only way to see if it was the Aromasin causing the problems was to go off of it.  Within two days I felt better. I have been off of it for a little over two weeks.  You can't help but question if you are doing the right thing.  I felt like I was finally taking control of my life with the exercise and diet and I have alot of faith which has really given me strength.  I feel so blessed to have been given 5 years.  But when I look back I really didn't do anything significant or meaningful.  I didn't think there would be a 2nd 5 year pill and in some ways I wish there hadn't been then there wouldn't be this question.  But I feel like all I can do now is take care of myself the best I can and turn it over to God and hopefully make a difference, whether I have  6 months or 6 years.  I look at life so differently now.  The last 5 years were more about me and now I hope to make the next 5 more about others and give back.. I hope to go on a mission trip this summer. I hope the Tamoxifin works for you.  I still haven't talked to my onchologist yet but am waiting for a call from her today.  I tried arimidex before I took the fareston and I couldn't take it either. I wish you the best and would like to hear from you. JoAnn
